tit.cmt: タイトルなので補足をのぞきました。

sen.j: 一条 内基（いちじょう ただもと／うちもと、天文 (元号)17年（1548年） - 慶長16年7月2日 (旧暦)（1611年8月9日））は、戦国時代 (日本)後期から江戸時代初期にかけての公家である。
sen.e: Born in 1548 and gone in 1611, - in detail, the date he was gone is July 2 by the lunar calendar (August 9 by the solar calendar) - Tadamoto (or Uchimoto) ICHIJO was a "kuge" (court noble) living from the late "Sengoku period" (the Warring States period in Japan) to the early Edo period.

Born in 1548, died in 1611, - in detail, the date he died was July 2 by the lunar calendar (August 9 by the solar calendar) - Tadamoto (or Uchimoto) ICHIJO was a "kuge" (court noble) living from the late "Sengoku period" (the Warring States period in Japan) to the early Edo period.
Tadamoto (also known as Uchimoto) ICHIJO (1548 - August 9, 1611) was a kuge (court noble) living from the late Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) to the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直し、表現を変えました。

sen.j: 左大臣。
sen.e: He rose to the title of "Sadaijin" (Great Minister of the Left).
He rose to the title of "Sadaijin" (Great Minister of the Left).
He rose to the title of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 本能寺の変が起きた時の関白。
sen.e: He served as "Kanpaku" (Chief Adviser to the Emperor) when "Honnoji no hen" (the Incident at Honno-ji Temple) occurred.
He served as "Kanpaku" (Chief Adviser to the Emperor) when "Honnoji no hen" (the Incident at Honno-ji Temple) occurred.
He served as Kanpaku (Chief Adviser to the Emperor) when Honnoji Incident occurred.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞき、用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 藤原北家摂関家一条家当主。
sen.e: He was the head of the Ichijo family, which belonged to the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan and served as the Family of Regent and Chief Adviser.
He was the head of the Ichijo family, which belonged to the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan and served as the Family of Regent and Chief Adviser.
He was the head of the Ichijo family, the Sekkan-ke (the families which produced regents) of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 号は自浄心院・翫月など。
sen.e: He was given some honorific titles, such as "Jijoshin-in" and "Gangetsu."
He was given some honorific titles, such as "Jijoshin-in" and "Gangetsu."
He was given some honorific titles, such as Jijoshinin and Gangetsu.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 一字名は杏。
sen.e: His one character name was "杏," which reads "kyo."
His one character name was "杏," which reads "kyo."
His one character name was 杏 (kyo).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 兄に一条兼冬。
sen.e: Kanefuyu ICHIJO was his elder brother.
Kanefuyu ICHIJO was his elder brother.
Kanefuyu ICHIJO was his elder brother.

sen.j: 天文17年（1548年）、関白一条房通の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: In 1548, Tadamoto was born as the second son of "Fusamichi ICHIJO" who rose to the title of Kanpaku.
In 1548, Tadamoto was born as the second son of "Fusamichi ICHIJO" who rose to the title of Kanpaku.
In 1548, Tadamoto was born as the second son of Fusamichi ICHIJO of Kanpaku.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 19歳離れた兄・兼冬の死により、一条家を嗣ぐ。
sen.e: Tadamoto became the heir of the Ichijo family because his 19-year-elder brother Kanefuyu died.
Tadamoto became the heir of the Ichijo family because his 19-year-elder brother Kanefuyu died.
Tadamoto became the heir of the Ichijo family because his 19-year-elder brother Kanefuyu died.

sen.j: 弘治 (日本)4年（1558年）元服、正五位下に叙され、永禄3年（1560年）には従三位に進んだ。
sen.e: In 1558, Tadamoto went through "genpuku" (a coming-of-age ritual for a boy) and got the investiture of "Shogoinoge" (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), and in 1560, he was promoted even higher to "Jusanmi" (Junior Third Rank).

In 1558, Tadamoto went through "genpuku" (a coming-of-age ritual for a boy) and got the investiture of "Shogoinoge" (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), and in 1560, he was promoted even higher to "Jusanmi" (Junior Third Rank).
In 1558, Tadamoto celebrated his attainment of manhood and got the rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), then in 1560, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 永禄8年（1565年）には権大納言となり、天正元年（1573年）には正二位に昇った。
sen.e: In 1565, he was given the title of "Gon no dainagon" (Deputy Major Councilor), and in 1573, he rose to "Shonii" (Senior Second Rank).
In 1565, he was given the title of "Gon no dainagon" (Deputy Major Councilor), and in 1573, he rose to "Shonii" (Senior Second Rank).
In 1565, he was given the title of Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state), and in 1573, he rose to the rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 同年、土佐国の分家（土佐一条氏）一条兼定を訪れ、同国へ逗留。
sen.e: In the same year, he visited the house of Kanesada ICHIJO, who lived in Tosa Province and belonged to the branch family of Ichijo (the Tosa-Ichijo clan), and sojourned there for some years.
In the same year, he visited the house of Kanesada ICHIJO, who lived in Tosa Province and belonged to the branch family of Ichijo (the Tosa-Ichijo clan), and sojourned there for some years.
In the same year, he visited Kanesada ICHIJO of a branch family in Tosa Province (Tosa Ichijo clan), and stayed the Province for some years.

sen.j: 兼定の子・一条内政（のち大津御所）の元服に際し、偏諱を与え、左近衛中将に推挙した。
sen.e: When Kanesada's son went through "genpuku," Tadamoto renamed the boy "内政," which reads Tadamasa, borrowing the Chinese character of "内" from his own name "内基," and Tadamoto recommended Tadamasa for "Sakonoe no chujo" (Middle Captain of the Left Palace Guards); incidentally, the boy named "Tadamasa ICHIJO" was "Otsu Gosho" in later days.
sen.cmt: ※「偏諱を与え」とは、「自分の名の一字を与えること」であり（kotobank.jp 「偏諱を賜う」参照)左でもそう訳したつもりです。
sen.e: When Kanesada's son went through "genpuku," Tadamoto renamed the boy "内政," which reads Tadamasa, borrowing the Chinese character of "内" from his own name "内基," and Tadamoto recommended Tadamasa for "Sakonoe no chujo" (Middle Captain of the Left Palace Guards); incidentally, the boy named "Tadamasa ICHIJO" was "Otsu Gosho" in later days.

When Kanesada's son Tadamasa ICHIJO celebrated his attainment of manhood, Kanesada granted Tadamasa to use a portion of his real name and recommended for Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせて表現を変えました。

sen.j: 天正3年（1575年）京都へ帰国、内大臣に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In 1575, Tadamoto returned to Kyoto, and he was appointed to "Naidaijin" (Great Minister of the Center).
In 1575, Tadamoto returned to Kyoto, and he was appointed to "Naidaijin" (Great Minister of the Center).
In 1575, Tadamoto returned to Kyoto, and he was appointed to Naidaijin (Minister of the Center).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせて表現を変えました。

sen.j: 天正4年（1576年）、右大臣。
sen.e: In 1576, he was appointed to "Udaijin" (Great Minister of the Right)
In 1576, he was appointed to "Udaijin" (Great Minister of the Right)
In 1576, he was appointed to Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせて表現を変えました。

sen.j: 同5年（1577年）には左大臣と昇進を重ね、天正9年（1581年）には正親町天皇の関白、藤氏長者となった。
sen.e: In 1577, he was promoted even higher to "Sadaijin" (Great Minister of the Left), and in 1581, he finally became "Kanpaku" of Emperor Ogimachi, which was "Toshi choja" (the chieftain of the Fujiwara family).

In 1577, he was promoted even higher to "Sadaijin" (Great Minister of the Left), and in 1581, he finally became "Kanpaku" of Emperor Ogimachi, which was "Toshi choja" (the chieftain of the Fujiwara family).

In 1577, he was promoted even higher to Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), and in 1581, he finally assumed the position of Kanpaku of Emperor Ogimachi, which was Toshi choja (head of the Fujiwara clan).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせて表現を変えました。

sen.j: 翌年には従一位に昇る。
sen.e: In the next year, he rose to "Juichii" (Junior First Rank).
In the next year, he rose to "Juichii" (Junior First Rank).
In the next year, he rose to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 天正12年（1584年）に左大臣・関白を辞し、二条昭実に譲る（翌年近衛信尹との間で関白相論となり、結局豊臣秀吉が関白となる）。
sen.e: In 1584, he departed both from "Sadaijin" & "Kanpaku," and transferred them to Akizane NIJO; in the next year, Akizane NIJO and Nobutaka KONOE had "Kanpaku soron" (struggle for Kanpaku), but it was Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI who actually became Kanpaku in the end.

In 1584, he departed both from "Sadaijin" and "Kanpaku," and transferred them to Akizane NIJO; in the next year, Akizane NIJO and Nobutaka KONOE had "Kanpaku soron" (struggle for Kanpaku), but it was Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI who actually became Kanpaku in the end.

In 1584, he departed both from Sadaijin and Kanpaku, and transferred them to Akizane NIJO (in the next year, Kanpaku soron (dispute over the kanpaku position) occurred with Nobutaka KONOE, but it was Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI who actually assumed the position of Kanpaku in the end).

sen.j: 子に恵まれなかったため、後陽成天皇の皇子・九宮を養子とし（一条昭良）、一条家を嗣がせた。
sen.e: Blessed with no child, Tadamoto adopted "Ku no miya,"who was a prince of Emperor Goyozei, and then renamed the prince "Akiyoshi ICHIJO," and Tadamoto made Akiyoshi the heir to the Ichijo family.
Blessed with no child, Tadamoto adopted "Ku no miya,"who was a prince of Emperor Goyozei, and then renamed the prince "Akiyoshi ICHIJO," and Tadamoto made Akiyoshi the heir to the Ichijo family.
Blessed with no child, Tadamoto adopted Kunomiya, who was a prince of Emperor Goyozei (then renamed the prince Akiyoshi ICHIJO) and made Akiyoshi the heir to the Ichijo family.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.e: In 1611, Tadamoto died.
In 1611, Tadamoto died.
In 1611, Tadamoto died.

sen.j: 享年64。
sen.e: He died at the age of 64.
He died at the age of 64.
Died at the age of 64.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 官職位階履歴
sen.e: Career of title & rank
Career title & rank
Official Record
sen.cmt: 他ファイルに合わせました。
